noKnowledgePoints: No knowledge points yet, click the button above to add the first one
recallPlaceholder: Enter what you can recall here...
question: Question
questionPlaceholder: e.g., What is a binary function?
answerPlaceholder: Enter detailed explanation of the knowledge point...
useActiveRecall: Use active recall to deepen memory
continueAddNewPoints: Continue adding new knowledge points or wait for next review
welcomeDescription: Use spaced repetition and active recall to improve memory
confirmDeleteDescription: Deleting this knowledge point will also delete related review plans. This action cannot be undone.
editDescription: Modify the question and answer of the knowledge point
addDescription: Add a new knowledge point, the system will automatically schedule review plans
autoRegisterSuccess: Account created and logged in successfully!
pointAdded: Knowledge point added! Review plan: in 1 day, 7 days, 16 days, 35 days
dataLoadFailed: Data loading failed, but you can continue using the app

metadata.title: Learning Assistant - Spaced Repetition and Active Recall
metadata.description: Use spaced repetition and active recall to improve memory

introduction: Learning Assistant helps you master knowledge through spaced repetition and active recall.

features.1: Add and manage knowledge points with questions and detailed answers.
features.2: Automatic review scheduling: 1 day, 7 days, 16 days, and 35 days later.
features.3: Practice active recall by writing what you remember before seeing the answer.
features.4: Track your progress and review only what's due today.

apiKeys.title: API Key Management
apiKeys.description: Manage your API keys for authentication
apiKeys.createDescription: Set a name for your API key to identify it
apiKeys.warning: Please save this API key securely. You will not be able to view the full key again.
apiKeys.deleteDescription: After deleting this API key, all requests using this key will fail. This action cannot be undone.
apiKeys.noKeysDescription: Create an API key to start using API features

mcp.title: MCP Integration Setup
mcp.description: Configure Cursor to connect to Learn Assistant MCP service
mcp.endpointDescription: The endpoint URL for Cursor to connect to the MCP service
mcp.apiKeyDescription: Use API Key for authentication. Create one if you don't have any yet
mcp.noApiKey: You don't have an API Key yet. Please create one first
mcp.apiKeyHint: Tip: You can go to the API Key Management page to create more API keys or manage existing ones
mcp.configDescription: Copy the following configuration to Cursor's MCP configuration file
mcp.step2Description: Open Cursor's MCP configuration file (click the button above to view the path)
mcp.step3Description: Paste the configuration into the file, save and restart Cursor
mcp.createApiKeyFirst: Please create an API Key first
mcp.createApiKeyFirstDescription: After creating an API Key, you will see the complete Cursor configuration example
